page.title: 09CAMBRIDGE
page.content: The original village of Cambridge although on the natural route from Bristol to Gloucester was able to exist in comparative tranquility and was able to offer refreshment to travellers who wished to break their journey. Of the two inns one, "The White Lion", now run by Mr K.W.Thomas, was established in 1760 and the other, "The George", now run by Mr R.Whitely, was established in the late Eighteenth Century. "The George" has built quite a reputation locally for its fine meals and in 1983 it won the "Best Wine Bar" award. The post office is a typical small village one which also serves as a village shop and newsagents. The only other shops are two small antique-type shops where one can buy or sell almost anything.
